title: Graphic Designer
description: Graphic Designer - Join Our High-Impact Design AgencyWe are a highly regarded and award-winning marketing agency in search of exceptional individuals who can make a significant impact. Currently, we have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Graphic Designer to join our fast-paced and dynamic design environment. If you possess exceptional skills and expertise for logos/branding, layout and design, along with a passion for delivering outstanding design work, we invite you to be a part of our team.As a Graphic Designer with our agency, you will thrive in an environment that offers a multitude of diverse and exciting project opportunities. From print to digital, our projects vary greatly, providing you with the chance to showcase your creativity and talent. With multiple projects having daily deadlines, we need an individual who can handle the demands of a fast-paced work environment while maintaining a high standard of design excellence.We are seeking a self-reliant professional who possesses a true passion for their craft. As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work independently, taking ownership of your projects and organizing your workflow efficiently. Our agency values individuals who excel in self-reliance and demonstrate the ability to deliver exceptional results, while still maintaining the highest standards of quality and creativity.At our agency, we focus on influencing audiences through the power of emotional marketing. We believe that focusing through emotion, we can drive results for our clients, within our team, and in our community. We cover a wide range of design projects, including print/digital campaigns, social media graphics, posters, logos/branding, presentations, web designs, and more. As a Graphic Designer, you will collaborate with a creative team to create captivating visual content that showcases the messaging and marketing efforts of our business and marketing clients.Responsibilities: Develop compelling visuals for digital, print, and web platforms, focusing on emotional ties to the audience Assist in the creation of campaign materials Provide support to clients and marketing staff by delivering amazing content Collaborate with a team to deliver innovative designs that elevate clients brands Create brand identities and style guides for clients Stay updated with the latest design trends and changes in design elements and theories Manage design requests for clients and internal purposes as required Actively participate in client meetings to understand requirements, manage reveal sessions, and present design concepts Organize workflows efficiently to stay ahead of deadlines and handle multiple projects simultaneously Requirements: Minimum of 7 years of post-graduate experience in graphic design (portfolio with examples required) Bachelors degree in Design (e.g., graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), or a related field Mastery of Adobe Creative Suite is essential shown through examples of logos, branding, layout design, brochures, flyers, web design and other design work. Understanding of the psychological motivation of emotionally driven content and how to manipulate that through design Strong core design skills including visual hierarchy, layout, typography, and color In-depth understanding of color and design theory Ability to effectively organize information through visual design Excellent time management skills to handle multiple projects efficiently Demonstrate ability to work self-reliantly and stay ahead of deadlines A drive to deliver the highest quality products, contribute to the growth of the company, and support overall agency goals Perks: Competitive salary ranging from $50,000 to $65,000 per year based on experience Comprehensive health, dental, and vision benefits Exciting variety of design work across different mediums Collaborative small-team office environment with significant impact opportunities Flexible schedules, including holidays, vacation, and personal time off Further professional development opportunities Join our team and unleash your creativity in a fast-paced and rewarding environment. We are committed to providing a diverse, inclusive, and supportive workplace where every individual is valued. Emotionally focused content drives our results not only for our clients, but also for the agency internally, and the team.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits: Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Professional development opportunities Vision insurance Schedule: 6-10 hour shifts Monday to Friday To apply, please submit your portfolio and resume, showcasing your relevant experience and skills in logo design, branding, layouts, and other business collateral. We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing how your expertise can contribute to our teams success.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $50,000.00 - $65,000.00 per yearBenefits: Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Englewood, CO 80112: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Application Question(s): On a scale from 1-10 (10 being Expert/Instructor level), how experienced in Photoshop are you? On a scale from 1-10 (10 being Expert/Instructor level), how experienced in Illustrator are you? On a scale from 1-10 (10 being Expert/Instructor level), how experienced in free hand/illustrative art are you? (if above 5+, please submit examples) Do you have minimum salary requirements? If yes, please state. Are you able to begin work, on location, within 3 weeks? Did you provide examples/portfolio link? (you must provide examples of logo work, layouts, branding and business collateral design to be considered) Education: Bachelors (Required) Experience: Adobe Creative Suite: 7 years (Required) post-graduate, professional work: 7 years (Required) Layout design: 7 years (Required) Work Location: Hybrid remote in Englewood, CO 80112

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Who we are:Axion’s mission is to create the world’s best automotive and aerospace engineering management analytics platform, powered by machine learning. We’re revolutionizing the way next-gen vehicles are made and have partnered with forward-looking engineering leaders to deploy machine learning models that will accelerate our speed to an electric, connected, supersonic future. Our team includes experts in Machine Learning, Enterprise AI, and SaaS from GoogleX, Spotify, Microsoft, Palantir, McKinsey & QuantumBlack, and other top tech companies. Since our founding at the onset of 2021, we’ve deployed across some of the largest Automotive and Aerospace companies in the world. If you want the chance to help build the future of engineering leadership, join us.Why Us:Join a fast-growing, early-stage startup with the chance to make a significant impact from day one. Our culture puts people first. We will encourage you to bring your full self to work and will set you up to succeed.You’ll also get: Highly competitive compensation Meaningful equity Leadership opportunity in a high-growth company A great team. We bring a unique combination of technical and business skills, with company leaders from top tech companies like Spotify, business leadership from McKinsey, and automotive leadership from GM and Ford. We’re an interdisciplinary team that prizes collaboration & diversity of thinking. Where you’ll be:Prefer an office to work? We have options for your working preferences. Prefer to work from home? You can Work From Anywhere at Axion.We are looking for a Product Designer who will: Strategise, sketch and design new products and features for a diverse set of users Translate user requirements and your own research into tangible design concepts to bring a product concept to life quickly Help run short design sprints and work in a fast-moving, agile environment Be able to conduct your own user research as well as building and testing prototypes Feel equally comfortable sketching and wireframing a design solution as you are making UI and data visualisations look beautiful and compelling Ideally help build out a design system and help develop patterns and components for re-use with our engineering teams Your expertise: 5 years’ experience designing user-centred products and enterprise applications, ideally with experience visualising data An awe-inspiring portfolio and a design process that you can articulate clearly Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain the rationale behind your design concepts Experience with agile methodologies and integrating design with cross-functional delivery teams An obsessive attention-to-detail in everything you do, from storytelling and clarity of communication through to detailed wireframes and UI designs Experience working with data science teams in an enterprise environment would be a huge advantage. Knowledge and experience using tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite Come work with us, were growing!

title: UX/UI Designer (Figma Proficient)80-100%
description: About the jobBhaasha is a technology company based in Y-Parc in Yverdon-les-Bains. We are passionate about implementing technological solutions to reduce linguistic and cultural barriers to access healthcare, social services, judicial services and education for migrants. We do this by connecting the right interpreter to the situations’ needs quickly and reliably, minimizing the administrative work. We are fast growing and in high demand across the Swiss public sector.Job Summary:We are seeking a passionate and creative UX/UI Designer with expertise in Figma to join us in our journey. As a UX/UI Designer, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create user-centric and visually appealing digital experiences. Your proficiency in Figma will be essential in translating design concepts into interactive prototypes and seamless user interfaces. If you are passionate about user experience, have a keen eye for detail, and excel at designing intuitive and delightful interfaces, we would love to hear from you!Responsibilities: Collaborate with the product manager, developers, and others to understand user needs & requirements. Create user flows, wireframes, and interactive prototypes using Figma to visualize and communicate design ideas effectively. Design visually appealing user interfaces that align with branding guidelines, usability principles, and industry best practices. Conduct user research to gather feedback and iteratively improve designs to enhance user experience. Collaborate closely with developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs and troubleshoot any UI-related issues. Stay up-to-date with the latest UX/UI design trends, tools, and techniques. Participate in design critiques, providing and receiving constructive feedback to improve designs. Advocate for user-centered design principles throughout the organization and promote a culture of empathy and user-centricity. Requirements: Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field to UX/UI design. A combination of education and relevant work experience will also be considered. Proficiency in Figma, with a deep understanding of its features and ability to utilize them efficiently. Proven experience as a UX/UI Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing your expertise in designing intuitive and visually appealing interfaces. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, interaction design, and information architecture. Strong visual design skills with an eye for detail, color, and typography. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively present and explain design concepts and rationale. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies is desirable. What we offer: Dynamic work environment with the opportunity to work on exciting projects Highly purpose-driven organization with a talented and fast-growing team looking to have a strong impact Flat hierarchy with the ability to take ownership and speak up Hybrid flexible working model Attractive compensation and benefits Initial 1 year contract with the possibility to extend If you are passionate about designing exceptional user experiences and have a deep understanding of UX/UI design, we would love to hear from you. To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio, and any other relevant design samples demonstrating your proficiency with UX/UI design.Contact:info@bhaasha.com+41 21 588 1070

title: Scroll Dependent Animated Landing Page
description: Looking for someone to make a simple landing page... Landscape where the centerpiece is a moosun that alternate upon scroll. Minimal text. No buttons or anything. Looking for it to be made ASAP and can be simplified/made moderminimalist if that would speed things up. Use your creative discretion!Here is some visual inspiration:https://imgur.com/a/IGw3KVS

title: PowerPoint Animator & Illustrator
description: We are seeking a talented and experienced PowerPoint Animator & Illustrator to help create high-quality, professional videos for our clientele of high-end estate planning lawyers. This role requires someone to take initiative to ensure the director’s script for the audio and visual components are synchonized seamlessly and intuitively in the PowerPoint presentation. This person should also have a keen eye for aesthetics, strong technical skills, and the ability to translate complex concepts into engaging visual stories. You will be in charge of designing custom characters and icons, creating animation within PowerPoint, and coordinating with actors for voiceover and music. Here are some sample videos:Sample 1Sample 2Key Responsibilities:1. Create custom design characters and icons in a classy, professional style suitable for a high-end professional audience.2. Revise and edit videos quickly in accordance with required timelines.3. Develop and implement advanced PowerPoint animations to create seamless, engaging videos.4. Collaborate with our team to convert storyboard ideas into powerful, captivating animations.5. Align with voiceover artists and musicians to incorporate audio elements into the video production.6. Continuously update and improve upon animation techniques, keeping up with industry trends and advancements.7. Ensure all design and animation aligns with the overall brand aesthetic and the objectives of each specific project.8. Work with multiple stakeholders to ensure videos meet project requirements and client expectations.9. Manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines consistently.Required Skills and Experience:1. Degree in Graphic Design, Animation, or related field, or equivalent experience.2. Proficiency in PowerPoint with a deep understanding of its animation capabilities.3. Proven experience in character design and illustration.4. Experience creating professional-grade videos, preferably for a professional services or legal audience.5. Proficiency in other design software such as Adobe Creative Suite.6. Exceptional creativity and innovative design skills.7. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.8. Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate design decisions.9. Ability to take direction, accept feedback, and collaborate effectively on a team.Preferred Skills and Experience:1. Experience working with estate planning lawyers or understanding of estate planning.2. Prior experience in a fast-paced, agency-type environment.3. Knowledge of other video editing software such as Premiere Pro, After Effects, etc.4. Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and project management tools.Soft Skills:1. Problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively.2. Adaptability and the ability to work under pressure.3. Proactive with the ability to anticipate needs and provide solutions.4. Self-motivated and capable of working independently.What Youll Get:1. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.2. Competitive compensation and benefits package.3. Collaborative and inclusive work environment.4. Work-life balance and flexible work arrangements.

title: Senior Design for Conservative YouTuber
description: Looking for an awesome designer for contract-to-full time work with a famous conservative influencer/creator. This designer must have a wide range of artistic abilities to create themes for e-learning video courses.Compensation: ~$85k+Full healthWe need a hard worker who is quick, passionate about amazing design, a great communicator, and takes constructive notes well.The work will be mostly creating static graphic styles, course titles and graphics, often using generative AI etc. Very rarely will you need to animate, but you must have an eye for animation. The work is fast paced and pays well.If you are conservative or libertarian, you will probably find the work very meaningful!Send portfolio to: jed@votaryfilms.com

They need to follow the theme of the channel in terms of branding. Attached is a sample of the images you will be making, we have PSDs from previous projects already for you to reference for textures/overlays and feel.

title: Product Marketing Designer, Freelance
description: Caraway is an NYC-based digital healthcare company for Gen Z providing mental, physical & reproductive healthcare services, all in one place. Our experienced Care Team delivers integrated, evidence-based care tailored to 18-29 year olds, available 24/7 through our mobile app. Our vision is big: were both treating our members needs in-the-moment, and providing them with the skills to manage their health over their lifetime. Our care platform is also centered around women and people assigned female at birth, recognizing that focusing on overlooked populations ultimately allows us to provide better care for everyone. If you want to be part of a mission-driven, motivated, collaborative team working to change healthcare for a generation, come join us!‍Our team is seeking a part-time designer to support our growth and marketing efforts for approximately 8-12 weeks. Under the direction of the Head of Brand Experience, this role will work closely with our Content, Engagement, and Product teams to develop marketing assets – including custom landing pages, decks, and marketing collateral – to support our member acquisition campaigns. We’re looking for a designer with an understanding of WebFlow, HTML and CSS, as well as a strong visual sensibility and understanding of core UX principles. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working independently, iteratively, and quickly to make an impact.‍Please provide your portfolio when applying. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered. What youll do Design and develop custom landing pages as part of our WebFlow website to drive new member sign-up as part of our acquisition campaigns, including podcast and newsletter ads. Partner with our Content lead to develop a suite of new email marketing and Instagram post templates. Design physical collateral (e.g. pamphlets, one-pagers) to be used with B2B partners, including student health centers and insurance providers to highlight Caraway’s services. Design additional collateral to be used by student ambassadors as part of campus events, including SWAG, flyers, and banners. Who you are You have at least 3-5+ years prior UI/UX product design experience working on consumer products, mobile apps, or at design-focused companies You have Knowledge of front end/mobile development languages, including experience working with HTML, CSS, and designing for software similar to WebFlow You have strong visual and graphic design skills, with layout experience for both print and web Experience with creative software including Canva, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), UXPin You have a deep understanding and proven experience with digital design for consumers, with a focus on web and mobile products You have strong knowledge of modern UI/UX and product design standards, as well as mobile/responsive techniques for web design You appreciate brand design and are comfortable both integrating with and evolving a brand’s visual identity to meet audience needs You’re a team player with low ego and a willingness to be curious and collaborative You’re mission-aligned, and excited to work on something that impacts the health of Gen Z, and focuses on women and AFAB people of all races, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations Bonus points for experience with direct to consumer solutions in women’s health care or other services for the Gen Z market, as well as experience working in growth stage business Comfort with simple coding, data tagging, animation skills, media editing, demo production also a plus Why youll love working hereCaraway offers the opportunity to be a part of a startup environment and work closely with the founding team and industry leading investors & advisors. Caraway offers the following benefits:‍ Competitive salary Mission-driven & team-oriented culture Hybrid & flexible working environment ‍Caraway is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and creating an inclusive work environment for all. All candidates are welcome to apply.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Please make sure to submit your professional portfolio in English while applying! 💸 26-34k EUR per year, full time contractor contract🇬🇧 £23-30k salary on a full time, permanent contract🌎 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!✨ Exciting products, millions of users, sold to global brands💻 Working with the latest hardware, tech stack and tools🏋️‍♀️ Access to benefits (country dependent 🌎 )ABOUT USFounded in 2008, we are an international team that works with incredible and globally-recognised clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry. Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en-masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends. Currently, we are a growing team of 125+ people, but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do. If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!RESPONSIBILITIESWhat can you expect? Reviewing never-before-seen TV episodes before they’re released Using Figma and Adobe Creative Suite to produce high-quality social content for high profile US TV clients Using existing branding guidelines and source material to create fun social media assets to engage fans and promote US TV shows Suggesting a variety of creative solutions and providing options for managers and clients to consider Following client accounts and competitors on social media to research and put forward own ideas for engaging and innovative content Producing assets that convey a clear and effective message with impact and creative flair that encourage click through or engagement Managing time well to produce multiple assets per day and communicate with managers on progress Learning our collaborative tools and using them to drive your assets through our internal processes Self-evaluating, proofing and reviewing own work Incorporating internal and client feedback into final product Developing your own skills by learning from other team members and through independent research QUALIFICATIONSWhats important to us: Excellent eye for detail particularly in regards to typography and layout Advanced understanding of Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop and Illustrator Experience and skills in illustratiodigital artwork Experience with producing fun, polished, well-designed assets Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines while maintaining accuracy Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities High work-ethic and self-motivation YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT Modern Tech StackWe use the latest tools, hardware and methodologies across our teams. We’re always on the look-out for new ways of working and ensure everyone is setup with enough hardware firepower to excel, Windows or Mac.Agility & Openness for IdeasWe actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here! Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.Outstanding PeopleWe believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality and skills, we’re an international team with more than 125 people onboard and we’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!FlexibilityWe’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. For this role, your working hours will be from 10am - 6pm (GMT+1). Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.PAYMENTWithin Europe, 26-34k EUR per year (or local currency equivalent) full-time contractor contract, depending on experience and skills.Within the UK, £23k-30k per year, depending on experience and skills.CONTRACT TYPEFull time contractor contract - fully remote working from anywhere in Europe! Permanent / Full time within the UKRECRUITMENT PROCESSFirstly, we will invite you to a first interview - Here you will meet Ciara, our Senior Manager of Content Production, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom. It’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team. If the technical interview with Ciara goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task followed by the final interview (30 minutes) with Nina, our Head of Content Production – it’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions.And that’s it!

title: Senior Designer
description: Job: Resign Internal Tools + Build Upcoming Website DesignsLocation: Remote.Who we are: Were a record label based in Cluj, Romania. Website: 11x11.ioWhat we need:Recently, weve created a lot of tools and dashboards using PowerBi and Airtable. However, the designs are all over the place and we need someone to help us connect everything and make it look good.We need help with redesigning all of our dashboards and connecting them together. These dashboards are related to accounting, music production, contracts, artist royalties, catalogue management, and analytics. We want all of these dashboards to be password-protected and available on our website.We also need help with designing a music storage and sharing app, similar to Dropbox and SoundCloud. We want it to be easy to use and have all the features we need.Lastly, we need a website design that displays our original songs catalog, which will act as a marketplace for smaller independent filmmakers and TV advertising teams to find songs that fit a specific vibe or sound.

title: Product Designer
description: About The Role:At Montra, we’re working to create a magical video creation experience; in doing so, design is at the centre of who we are. As our first product design hire, youll work closely with our CEO to wireframe, design and ultimately shape the user experience and interface beyond our initial MVP. You’ll have the autonomy to take risks and challenge the norms well beyond your typical video editor.What You’ll Do: Work closely with our CEO to build upon our existing distinct product and brand guidelines Own the design process from start to finish, including wire-framing, prototyping, and developer walk-through Frequently iterate on designs based on internal and external feedback Simplify complex design problems into beautiful user experiences Who You Are:Must Have 2-5 yrs of UI/UX design experience Proficient in working collaboratively in Figma Obsessed with crafting simple and gorgeous user experiences A robust portfolio of past work/projects demonstrating your ascetic and abilities to simplify complex problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills Great To Have Deep interest in the future of video as a communication method and how we’ll build products that shape that future Self-motivated person who can work individually and as part of a team Experience in working in remote and in person teams Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment How to Apply:At Montra, we believe the best team members come from diverse backgrounds and bring unique experiences to work. We don’t care where you came from, where you went to school, or what you do. We simply care about your grit, work ethic, and passion for video as a mechanism for sharing ideas. While the makeup of our team is not all one and the same, we are all bonded by our belief that a world where more people can create videos they’re proud of is a world we all want to live in. If that sounds like a world you want to help create, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Graphic Designer Baseball Merchandise
description: We are looking for a skilled Graphic Designer to join our team for a 1 to 3-month project. As a Graphic Designer for our baseball apparel merchandise, you will be responsible for creating visually appealing designs for t-shirts and other clothing items.The ideal candidate should have strong skills in Graphic Design and be proficient in Adobe Illustrator. Experience in T-Shirt Design and Clothing & Merchandise Design is highly desired. Knowledge of sports and recreation, as well as a passion for baseball, is a plus. To be considered for this position, please submit a proposal describing how you can contribute to the project. Additionally, please include links to your portfolio or past completed projects related to clothing and merchandise design. We look forward to reviewing your application and finding the perfect candidate to help us create amazing baseball apparel merchandise. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing baseball apparel company seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer to join our team on a freelance basis. As a Graphic Designer, you will play a crucial role in designing eye-catching and unique merchandise for our baseball-themed apparel line. Your designs will be featured on a wide range of products, including t-shirts, caps, hoodies, jerseys, and more.Responsibilities:Collaborate with the marketing and product development teams to understand design requirements and brand guidelines.Create original and engaging designs for baseball apparel merchandise, ensuring they align with our brand identity and target audience.Develop graphics, illustrations, and logos that can be utilized across various merchandise items.Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends, techniques, and industry best practices.Prepare and deliver design assets in various formats suitable for production and printing.Iterate on designs based on feedback from internal stakeholders to ensure high-quality and visually appealing products.This is a remote freelance position. We welcome applications from candidates located anywhere globally. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your understanding.Companies that we will be competing with are https://www.bl101.com/ , https://www.baseballism.com/ , https://routine.com/ so you can get an idea of what we are looking for.

title: Founding Product Designer (who can code)
description: Hybrid (Washington DC) | Remote (United States)About the companyAt Move AI, were tackling the chaos and stress of moving by creating a simplified, customer-centric product that makes the entire moving process seamless.Were developing a robust platform that handles every facet of relocation, from the initial planning to post-move recurring services. This isnt just about hiring a great mover or changing addresses. Its about building a comprehensive solution that answers to every possible worry, giving our customers the peace of mind they deserve during this transitional phase of their lives. Anything they made need in their life, we want to be there to connect them.Were leveraging advanced AI and automation to not only enhance the customer experience but revolutionize marketplace experience as a whole. The fragmented, non-transparent nature of this industry is now our competitive advantage.About the roleWere seeking a Founding Product Engineer at Move AI. This isnt a regular role - youll be critical to the development of our product, from user research to front-end execution. You will have a significant equity stake in the business. If you have experience in design and full-stack development, thats exactly what we need. Youll spend weeks in Figma and then weeks coding.About youYou want to work on a small team of people who are all builders. Were looking for someone who can communicate clearly and directly. You have the ability to identify the core issues. You should have substantial experience in product design and development, or enough to know where the usual potholes are. Youre adept at using Figma and making quick, informed decisions. You know how to create a front end website using a modern javascript framework.If this resonates with you, please apply here. Lets build something great.What youll own Perform user research to understand the moving process and our customers painpoints better. Work with the team to develop design an overall design strategy Create many creative concepts quickly in Figma Get feedback on those designs from the team Iterate on feedback. Making it real: Youll translate Figma to a front end html, css and javascript. Your ability to connect design to back-end/AI/ML is key. What youll do You’ll be the design team (research, user experience, user interaction, visual design) Youll be the front end team What were seekingMust haves Proficiency in rapid prototyping and interface design tools such as Figma. Demonstrated ability to design user-centric products based on user research. Proven ability to identify and address root problems efficiently. Direct, straightforward communication style, able to convey complex concepts with clarity. Ability to work independently and make quick decisions based on your experience and judgement. A track record of shipping high-quality software products on time. Experience with agile development methodologies and a preference for a fast-paced, iterative design and development process. Familiarity with modern frontend frameworks and libraries (React, Vue, Angular). Nice to Haves Strong experience with full-stack development. We need you to be able to contribute across the entire tech stack Experience or interest in AI and machine learning, as our product heavily relies on these technologies. Prior work in a startup environment. Comfort with quick changes and a high degree of autonomy is beneficial. Knowledge or experience about the moving process. Certainly not a deal breaker if youve never moved in your life, but probably a red flag if youve lived in the same place your whole life. Back-end experience, particularly with cloud services and databases. Move AI is compliant with AI Employment Regulation

title: Senior Product Designer
description: SeatGeek believes live events are powerful experiences that unite humans. With our technological savvy and fan-first attitude we’re simplifying and modernizing the ticketing industry.Whether it’s celebrating your favorite team’s victory, dancing to your favorite DJ with thousands of new friends, or enjoying your favorite Broadway show, one thing is for certain: nothing beats live. SeatGeek is on a mission to transform the $300 billion ticketing industry. Ticketing is complex; the variety of end users and UX flows makes for challenging and fascinating design work. We’ve created products for fans and venues that make ticketing easier, more modern, and more fun. We’ve done a lot already, and we’re excited to grow our design team so we can keep innovating. Join us! Product design at SeatGeekWe’re a group of passionate, humble, and curious designers and researchers distributed across the globe. We pride ourselves on our attention to detail and culture of craftsmanship. We believe collaboration is the key to our success, and that great ideas can come from anyone, regardless of experience, title, or background. We value maker time, asynchronous communication, lifelong learning, and making space to gain the perspectives and experiences needed to create our best work and live our best lives.What you’ll doYou’ll work closely with a cross functional team of product managers, engineers, data analysts, and user researchers to advance user and business goals. Your work will focus on: Defining user-centered problem statements to bring clarity to what we’re trying to accomplish and why it’s important to fans. Conceptualizing and designing solutions that push forward user and business goals. Working with your research and product partners to uncover user problems and evaluate solutions. Producing high fidelity deliverables that obsess with implementation ease just as much as pixel-perfection Driving design quality forward with designs that instill trust with our users and deliver moments of delight Collaboratively improving our design systems to ensure consistency and high quality experiences across all our products. Who you are 10+ years of product design experience. You have a 4+ hours of overlap with a 9:30am-5:30pm workday (US East Coast). You’ve been part of successful cross-functional and outcome-oriented teams. You have an eye for detail and a high-bar for design quality. You get just as excited about defining the problem as you do about exploring solutions. Value lifelong learning and are always looking for new ways to learn and grow. Perks Equity stake Flexible work environment, allowing you to work as many days a week in the office as you’d like or 100% remotely A WFH stipend to support your home office setup Flexible PTO Up to 16 weeks of paid family leave 401(k) matching program Health, vision, dental, and life insurance Annual subscriptions to Headspace, Ginger.io, and One Medical $120 a month to spend on tickets to live events Annual subscription to Spotify, Apple Music, or Amazon music

title: Senior Designer
description: Stacvalley, Germanys leading marketing agency for Amazon sellers, is on the lookout for a talented and experienced Senior Designer to join our dynamic and creative team. While our headquarters are in Germany, this specific role is open to candidates interested in working remotely.As a Senior Designer at Stacvalley, youll be responsible for designing and creating high-quality product images. Your creative abilities will play a pivotal role in narrating the story of each product and enticing buyers to press the purchase button.Responsibilities: Designing and creating appealing product images that highlight the USPs and foster buyer engagement. Collaborating with the marketing and product team to bolster the visual communication and brand identity of our clients on Amazon. Continuously updating and adapting to the latest design trends and best practices in the e-commerce industry. Adhering to project timelines and ensuring compliance with quality standards across all design projects. Qualifications: A minimum of three years of experience in a similar role, ideally in an agency specializing in Amazon or other e-commerce platforms. An impressive portfolio that showcases your ability to develop and implement creative concepts. Expert knowledge in common design software tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, etc. Strong organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication skills and the ability to accept and implement constructive feedback. If youre passionate about delivering groundbreaking creative work and want to write the next chapter of your career in one of Germanys most successful agencies, we look forward to your application. Your creative abilities have the potential to create a ripple in the Amazon marketplace, and we cant wait to achieve that with you.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Skydio is the leading US drone manufacturer and world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial transportation. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, and operational excellence to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users - from action sports enthusiasts to first responders.About the role: As a Senior Product Designer you will research, prototype, design and ship web and mobile applications that unlock Skydio hardware’s potential across a wide array of inspection, industrial, construction, public safety and defense use cases. You will work directly with the Sr. Director of Product Design, Designers, Product Managers, and Engineers to understand our customers most pressing needs and build incredible cross-platform experiences:How youll make an impact: Design core and new functionality for Skydio Cloud. These include: Media Management Fleet Management Inspection & Mapping Data Visualization Annotation and Records Tools Remote Operation Go on-site with customers to deeply understand their needs, use cases and work with Product Managers and Engineers to build incredible new AI based tools that customers love Work with other designers, engineers and marketers to build out the Skydio Design Language across our Cloud, Mobile, and Marketing experiences. Discover, design and document new components, modules, visual styles and treatments that will create a toolbox for ALL designers to build more efficiently and cohesively Provide mockups, user flows, pixel-perfect designs in Figma, or write HTML/CSS directly to drive the design process for engineers, while communicating design goals to PMs and Executives Bring your insights and experience to improve production and processes around the design org What makes you a good fit: Proven track record of delivering effective design to consumer and/or enterprise customers A portfolio that clearly defines your contributions shipping cloud products in multiple disciplines within design including: Photo management Data or Fleet Management Geospatial Analysis or Mapping 3D Web Tools Video Review Workflows Remote Hardware Sensing (cameras, robotics, aviation) Solid understanding of design systems that span mobile, web and marketing Strong examples of beautiful data, visualization, 3d, and table layout and visual design Bonus Experience: Familiarity with 3D for Web (WebGL, Cesium, ThreeJS) Some front-end coding ability in HTML/CSS/Javascript Familiarity with Front-end design libraries like Ant, Bootstrap, Tailwind CSS. Familiarity with 3D Animation tools like Cinema4D, Blender, Maya and After Effects

title: Administration support
description: I am looking for a freelancer based in the USA who can provide administration support for my business. The ideal candidate will have experience in data entry and be able to assist with various tasks such as email management and scheduling appointments.Specific requirements for the project include:- Data entry tasks- No specific software or tool required- Approximately 10-20 hours of assistance per weekSkills and experience needed for this project:- Proficient in data entry- Strong organizational and time management skills- Attention to detail- Ability to manage emails and schedule appointmentsIf you have the necessary skills and availability, please submit your proposal. Thank you.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer For Mobile App
description: I am looking for a Senior UX/UI designer to design the UX/UI pages of the mobile app. It is preferable to have designed an application for payment systems before. Share your sample applications and portfolio. To get more details about the availability of the job and to apply, kindly send an application alongside your portfolio on tel-gram to our Director…Search and send a direct message to: Kelli_100

title: Senior Product Designer
description: As a Senior Product Designer, you will have significant ownership of design objectives and strategy. This role will be responsible for discovering opportunities for product excellence and differentiation on our products. Combining an understanding of business opportunities with a deep empathy for the user, you’ll work on creating experiences that help customers invest in alternatives to improve their overall wealth. You’ll collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to determine strategy, roadmaps and deliverables while also maintaining a lot of autonomy over your work.What youll do:Product Strategy Conceptualize and design for web (including mobile) and print Contribute at a high level for design strategy and communicate the vision, roadmap, and goals for a business Define short- and long-term design opportunities for the product. Collaborate closely with Product Management, Engineering, Analytics and Business Development to define product solutions as well as business efficiencies Partner with Product Managers to develop the strategy and rationale for product solutions Partner closely with Engineering to ensure our implementation and user experience is of high-quality Prioritize internal, cross-functional, and external design resource(s). Create and iterate on solutions that are inspired by a deep empathy for our users Identify key opportunities to meet and prioritize user and business needs Use research and data to inform and implement solutions Ideate new product features and improvements. Work collaboratively to prioritize feature ideas. Flesh out feature concepts. UX Design Develop strategic insights and strategies to guide UX development Create high level user flows for complex products. Design processes, features, and components that can be used Understand business and technical needs Works cross-functionally (in and outside of the product team) to create innovative features. UI Design Design processes, features, and components that can be used across products Create UI components for product flows. Contribute components to the Alto design system. Work collaboratively with Engineering to ensure finished product meets design specifications. Work in close collaboration with Design Leadership to grow the team as well as to inform and improve design processes What wed like to see on your resume: 6+ years professional experience, specifically as a Product Designer designing web-based products, with experience with UX and UI. Bachelors degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience. Experience leading and launching end-to-end product / product features Design Portfolio demonstrating strong UX and visual design solutions, with an emphasis on identifying and meaningfully solving true user problems. Exceptional track record executing on product design strategy, mentoring designers, and partnering with cross functional team members. Experience building world class product experiences, and streamlining workflows with continuous iteration and improvement. What you bring to the table: High proficiency in Figma Familiarity with other UX/UI software for creating flows, prototypes Ability to analyze and use data and research to inform decisions Utilize understanding and analysis of quantitative data, qualitative user understanding, and knowledge of business capabilities to develop features and product experiments Attention to detail Humble — Not driven by personal opinions Excellent verbal and communication skills Excellent analytical skills to break down and solve complex problems Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally Design discovery (user research, competitive research) Deep user empathy around complex/emotional categories Foundational understanding of HTML and CSS. Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to lead user experience design, including usability principles, user research methodology, testing techniques (A/B, Multi-Variant), design theory, and interaction design. Willingness to roll up your sleeve and get things done. Take smart risks and champion new ideas. Passionate about contributing and maintaining design systems Skills such as illustration, animation, data visualization, front-end programming, or copywriting a plus

title: Web Designer
description: Were looking for a Designer who will be working with MyZenTeam — a team engagement platform. You’ll be in charge of our website, supervise that our brand will be consistent on different platforms (newsletters, lead magnets, social media) and offer design solutions to improve the experience for our customers.About usThe Remote Company is a network of remote-first tech companies. Were united by our values and approach to doing business.Our team has been working remotely for the last 8 years. We are very proud of the culture we have built and strongly believe that diverse teams have more potential to build successful global products. Please check our values to see if we are a right place for you. Glassdoor reviews will give you an inside look at what its like to work at The Remote Company.In 2022, Vercom, a cloud communication platform, acquired our product MailerLite with its subsidiary products MailerSend and MailerCheck for $90 million. It allowed us to put more resources and effort into our new products Ycode, MyZenTeam and Partnero.What we expect from you 2+ years experience working as a web designer. Experience working with Figma or Sketch. Knowledge of front-end development languages such as HTML and CSS. Practical knowledge of color theory, grid layout, typography, and graphic design. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in English. Attention to detail (when you apply, include the phrase love my job somewhere in your application). Open-mind with the ability to adapt and acquire technical knowledge quickly. Huge plus if you have experience in SaaS product design. Bonus skills You have experience using frameworks like Tailwind or Bootstrap. You have basic knowledge of Vue.js or Javascript in general. You have some copywriting experience. What we offerSalary: $50,000-$70,000 (gross)

title: Digital Specialist
description: The Air Line Pilots Association, International (ALPA), the largest airline pilot union in the world and the largest non-governmental aviation safety organization in the world (representing over 74,000 pilots at 42 U.S. and Canadian airlines) seeks an experienced Digital Specialist for our McLean, Virginia, office. The Digital Specialist provides digital creative and technical strategy to advance and support the Air Line Pilot Association’s online communications goals by maintaining and updating digital communications channels. As a self-starter, they will be responsible for maintaining websites for pilot groups including writing and creating content, posting on websites, styling websites, and working with the website team to keep websites current and updated. They also play a role in editing and creating email templates and sending email in ALPA’s email client, while supporting the mission, vision, and values of ALPA and striving to further the Association’s goals in the aviation industry. Daily, they will receive requests from pilot groups to upload files and content to websites as well as adjusting modules, layouts, and forms. Interested applicants will be requested to submit online portfolio link(s) showing previous work. Travel: 2 - 10%. ALPA is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in a safe workplace. We prohibit discrimination, harassment and harmful behavior of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or other protected characteristics as outlined in federal or provincial laws. We highly value everyone and all are encouraged to apply, including minorities, veterans, and people with disabilities.Qualifications: · Bachelors degree in relevant area, e.g., Digital Media, Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, or related field preferred, from an accredited college or university; or, the equivalent combination of education and practical experience.· Minimum three (3) years of experience and demonstrated expertise in digital content strategy, email messaging, website development, and/or digital design, five (5) or more years strongly preferred.· Experience with email CRM platforms and Microsoft Office suite strongly preferred.· Ability to be a self-starter and manage daily workloads and project list independently with minimal supervision.· Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and familiarity with other markup and/or programming languages strongly preferred.· Experience designing for digital platforms within the Adobe Creative Cloud.· Ability to quality control text documents for distribution on web and email platforms.· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, oral and written, for effective interaction with internal staff, external contacts, and pilots.· Ability to manage multiple projects at once, take direction from multiple sources, and meet deadlines.· Strong writing skills with command of grammar, syntax, and usage.· Strong proofreading skills.· Strong organizational skills.· Ability to understand and decipher information and documents of a technical nature.· Experience working with audio and video editing software a plus. Knowledge of labor-related issues preferred.· Ability to test and troubleshoot software.· Familiarity with new technologies and software for enhancing text, photographs, and graphics, strongly preferred.· Knowledge of labor-related issues strongly preferred.· Software: Proficiency in Content Management Systems. Proficiency with Adobe Suite for web publishing and graphic design including Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, Adobe XD, and Dreamweaver. Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and SharePoint. Physical Demands: Note: The physical demands described herein are characteristic of those that must be met to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential physical activities of this position described below. Constantly operates a computer/smartphone/tablet. Regularly required to maintain a stationary position, move about the office and the local metropolitan area, determine what others have said or written, and converse with others and exchange accurate information. Regularly required to sit, stand, bend, reach, and move about the office and travel locally and nationally; international travel may be required infrequently. Also includes occasional bending, stooping, squatting, and/or pushing and pulling or moving, e.g., to pack, unpack, and/or move cases. Occasionally required to move, raise, reach, and/or retrieve binders, books, boxes, and files up to ten (10) pounds (lbs.). While on travel, may be responsible to move, raise, reach, and/or retrieve luggage weighing as much as fifty (50) lbs. (Assistance may not always be available.) Please apply online at https://jobs-alpa.icims.com/jobs/1461/digital-specialist/job ALPA offers competitive salaries with terrific benefits, including:· 401k Plan with Non-Elective Employer Contribution of 13% after 180 days of employment. No employee contribution required! The plan includes a Roth option and 4-year vesting schedule.· Generous health care benefits on day one – PPO, Kaiser (where available), and a High Deductible Health Plan which includes coverage for medical, dental, and vision benefits for employee, spouse, and/or dependent children;· 27 days paid vacation and holidays per year plus 2 volunteer days per year;· Generous sick and bereavement leave;· Competitive parental leave;· Company-paid premiums for disability and life insurance;· Flexible Spending and Health Savings accounts;· Retiree health plan;· Education Assistance Program; and,· Optional benefits including pet insurance, excess life insurance, legal plan, and qualified transportation fringe benefits, where available. Relocation not provided.Sponsorship not available for this position.

title: Product Designer
description: Product DesignerAt Networx, we empower great people to do great work! Our core values are Chop Wood Carry Water, Do the Right Thing, Celebrate Success, and Evolve. These values guide our behaviors, and bold targets encourage us to bring our best selves to work daily. Our culture of fun, collaboration, and growth will help us all to share in the rewards of meeting our company mission; “Win Contractors More Jobs.”We are looking for a Product Designer to work on various products we develop for our customers. Product Designer responsibilities include defining product specifications, creating digital or print drawings and designing fully-functional products. To be successful in this role, you should have an eye for design and be able to translate requirements into practical product features. Ultimately, you will help us build products that are easy to use and visually appealing to our potential customers.What youll do Problem solve, think big, and explore divergent concepts/ideas while understanding how to converge and build iteratively toward your vision Partner with our Product team, take conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and outstanding. Design flows and experiences that simplify and distill down complex actions into usable interfaces Design new experiences or layouts that evolve and define visual systems Contribute to strategic decisions around the future direction of Networx products Drive a partnership with product managers, engineers, researchers, and content strategists in order to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launchWhat youll need 3-5 years of experience building b2c products (Web or Mobile) UI/UX Design Experience Deep understanding of interaction design with the knowledge to define how an experience should behave based on understanding peoples needs, plus consideration of how this product will scale. Use appropriate prototyping tools to demonstrate how a particular flow or interaction will work. Visual design experience with proficiency in typography, desktop/mobile UI, color, layout, iconography, and aesthetic sense and how these elements impact product function. Highly proficient with design tools (Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Highly proficient with interactive prototyping tools (Framer, Principle, Origami, Invision Studio, etc.) What Youll Earn Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Retirement Plan (401k) Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D) Paid Time Off (Vacation, Bereavement & 9 Paid Holidays) Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Training & Development Work From Home Wellness Resources Competitive pay and bonus This position is hybrid with infrequent in office days for collaboration and open to candidates who live in the Atlanta or New York City Metropolitan areas.Why are we a great company to work for?Networx is a rapidly evolving, growth-oriented company with international operations.We invest in people. We consider each employee a long-term investment, and we see value in continuously nurturing and training our teammates. We offer and encourage ongoing knowledge-sharing, training, and career growth opportunities.Networx has a flexible approach to in-office work; for those living in the Atlanta, GA, or New York, NY Metropolitan areas. This position is considered Hybrid with infrequent required and nonrequired days in the office for collaboration. Networx proudly supports diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.DISCLAIMER: The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

title: A Designer Thats Work Shows They Care
description: What We Are Looking For:We are looking for a designer, artist, and creative that DEEPLY CARES about creating magical products. We are looking for someone who wants to create a brand and experience that they view as a masterpiece they are proud of for decades to come.30,000 Foot View On Air:At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer’s faces to light up. We are currently working on a suite of products that help businesses scale rapidly… from a fintech platform that facilitates high ticket purchases, to a conversational AI that can have full-blown 25 minute sales calls and is indistinguishable from a human. Because of our customers love for our products, we’ve generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching Air 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).Comp:Salary: $120k-$250k a yearOwnership: 0-1% equityThe Most Important Question: Why Air?You are on a floating rock in the middle of the universe. Let that sink in.The truth is… you do not need another “job.” — if that is what you are looking for, you can save your time and just stop reading now.What you need is to be a part of something that matters — to be a part of something that causes you to tap dance into work everyday.At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer’s faces to light up.After all, that is the real goal of building software… not to generate ARR, not to prop up your valuation, not to raise more capital… but to create products you are proud to stamp your name on and to create products that are a part of your life story.And the fascinating dichotomy that our team at Air believes in strongly is that a team obsessed with creating great products always has more success than a team focused primarily on making money.At Air, our focus on product is why we have generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).We aren’t building Air to sell in the next few years or to add some zero’s to our net worth. We want to build a company that lives long past any of our founders. A company that maintains an essence of excellence over the long term. A company that people can feel is synonymous with quality.We are looking for more A players to join our team that meet these 3 criteria:1. Someone Willing To Work Obsessively On Something They Truly Believe In (An Obsessive... They Think About “Air” All The Time)2. Someone With Years Of Evidence Of Exceptional Ability At Their Craft (And Learns Rapidly)3. Someone Who Is “One Of Us” - The Thought Of Working With Them Everyday Excites Us (Businesses Are At Their Best When Everyone Enjoys Who They Are Going To War With Everyday)What would I be working on at Air?We have multiple areas a designer and creative could step in and have an immediate impact on our customer experience and brand as a whole: UI & UX: Helping create a unified experience across our suite of products. We want people to see our products and at a glance say Oh, that must have been built by Air Logos: We have multiple new products in development that will need on brand logos Website: Our current website is meh - We have a strong vision for how we could better convey what we are building and what we stand for Next steps?If you want to learn more about our vision and are curious about what we are building at Air and how you could contribute, apply belowCaleb Maddix, Co-Founder Of Air.ai

title: Brand Designer
description: About Us At Airhouse we help high-growth ecommerce companies simplify one of the most complex functions in their business: operations. Airhouse automates dozens of workflows and integrations to help companies get their products from factory to front door. From inventory and order management to warehouse partner sourcing and vetting, order fulfillment, returns and beyond, Airhouse makes it so that teams dont need to build a massive in-house operations team or any custom tech to manage fulfillment. Airhouse was founded in 2018, launched publicly in 2020, and currently serves 100+ high-growth businesses that manufacture everything from apparel to furniture to food and beverages.Airhouse’s core industry, logistics, is not historically design-forward. But, our customers are often themselves very creative brand-builders. At Airhouse, brand is a strategic imperative: we aim to make a memorable splash in the industry and in the minds of our customers. In this role as Brand Designer, you will grow Airhouse’s core style in new and experimental directions and own Airhouse’s overall look and feel.The right candidate for this role will be a creative but grounded designer who is skilled at balancing the competing demands of projects where design is involved, e.g. designing for conversion and designing within technical constraints.This is a full-time remote role that reports directly to our Co-Founder. Eligible candidates must be based in the United States. You will join as a senior individual contributor, with budget to extend your impact via outsourced agencies and consultants.Responsibilities Own our visual brand and its evolution in tandem with our Co-Founder and act as its guardian across the organization and the internet; ensure we create a single, cohesive experience of Airhouse, in particular for customers, but also for current and prospective employees, partners and others Develop visual concepts and materials for lead generation campaigns (ads, landing pages, social media graphics, etc.) with a cohesive look and feel, working with the team to quickly develop and test different iterations Wireframe and design responsive webpages in Webflow for our marketing website, airhouse.io, with a mobile-first approach (bonus if you can implement pages in Webflow) Design templates and graphics for sales proposals, marketing guides, ebooks, blog posts, documentation, presentations and other materials Create illustrations and diagrams for documentation to explain complex features, benefits and workflows for Sales, Marketing and Customer Success use Work closely with our Product Designer to ensure a single look and feel extends across all Airhouse properties and collaborate on maintaining a single, dynamic shared design system in Figma Manage design-related contractors and agencies alongside functional project leads, art direct and QA external design work to ensure it matches our brand and is functional, ensure production timelines are met, and secure resources where there are gaps Proactively help monitor written style when designing different materials and loop in relevant team members for content writing/voice and tone support Skills and Experience 3-5+ years working in brand, communications or visual design Some non-agency/in house experience preferred Strong art direction experience; you should feel comfortable taking our existing style guide, creating assets consistent with it, and then extending it, especially as it relates to graphics and illustration Strong grasp of grid systems, typography, and underlying design layout/composition principles Power user of Figma and Adobe CC: you not only know how to use these tools, but also believe in creating scalable design systems and asset libraries so that you can design efficiently and quickly onboard other designers onto projects Strong experience with design principles for web, including mobile-first responsive design Prior experience working with engineers to give feedback on implementation to match mockups, or strong HTML/CSS skills and the ability to work in Webflow Bonus if you have experience with any of the following: motion graphics, 2D illustration, 3D illustration, photography, video Benefits and Perks Competitive salary and equity based on experience A remote-first work environment with a headquarters in downtown San Francisco Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, ancillary) Flexible time off policy that encourages you to take time off when you need it Optional all-team meetups A remote work stipend to create a productive work environment wherever you may be Paid parental leave and short-term and long-term disability insurance For consideration, please submit a portfolio demonstrating your ability to design across multiple standard business formats, with art direction examples.Equal Opportunity EmploymentAirhouse is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity of all kinds and believe it contributes to our success as we build a world-class company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, neurotype, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal or state law.

title: Product Designer
description: Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept:Joining our small design team means you’ll be working on a diverse range of projects with the opportunity to choose your own path, take ownership, and make a big impact. As we revolutionize the way people manage their expenses, being part of the Expensify team means designing the easiest, most efficient, and most beautiful platform to handle everything expense-related. Our employees work from all over the world, but if you’re looking for a change of scenery we offer visa sponsorship and relocation assistance to join us at one of our rad locations: San Francisco Portland Michigan New York London Melbourne And more to come! Even though we work hard at Expensify, we make sure our employees are happy. Our most talked about perk is our Offshore where we spend a month abroad working from a remote location as a team. Next year we’re going to South Korea, do you want to join?About YouWe’re looking for Product Designers who operate at the intersection of product functionality and brand feeling. You’re obsessive over the small details, but you enjoy solving big-picture problems to help push our strategic roadmap forward—all while maintaining the highest level of design delight in our product. You’re a systems-based thinker who likes developing clean and consistent UI patterns, and you’re also a generalist who loves working on the marketing design side of the role as well. As a Product Designer your responsibilities include: Working with our product and engineering teams to plan, design, and build new features and functionality Materially contributing to product roadmap decisions by balancing our company vision and business objectives against customer requirements Building, documenting, and maintaining our product design system in Figma, and working closely with our engineering team to make it come to life in our product Taking ownership over the product to push for the highest level of quality: no bug is too small to squash Designing and developing Expensifys visual brand Completing marketing design tasks like collateral, events, and promotions We’re looking for someone who: Has a high level of proficiency in Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite Has experience designing, building, and shipping end-to-end user flows Is comfortable working on front end issues and has a strong grasp of HTML and CSS basics Has a solid portfolio with an emphasis on product design Has a passion for detail, and an excellent use of type and layout in both digital and print Can effectively communicate ideas to teammates through mockups, prototypes, and concise written communication Is independently driven and comfortable working on projects autonomously Is capable of efficiently prioritizing multiple tasks across multiple teams Is a problem-solver and question-asker with a positive attitude Has a desire to learn and grow outside of their comfort zone Compensation & Benefits Full-time, salaried position 401k with 4.5% employer match 100% Medical/Dental/Mental Health support/Vision contributions Three months of fully paid parental leave, with up to six months for birthing parents Fully paid medical leave Commuter benefits (if applicable) $20 to spend on lunch daily Flexible vacation policy Relocation available Next StepsApplying is easy, but it takes time. See, while we know youre awesome, its actually really hard and time consuming to find you in the midst of literally hundreds of other applications we get from everyone else. So this is where were going to ask our first favor: can you make it really easy and obvious how great you are, so we dont accidentally overlook you? There are probably many ways to do that, but the easiest way to help us out is by answering the following questions: Please include a link to your portfolio (or include it here). If you don’t have one, why not? Whats your design history? When did you start, and what have you done between then and now? What do you want to do with the rest of your life, and how is Expensify a step toward your long-term goals? (We’re serious, we want to know! Share what you’re comfortable sharing, but we are a group of ambitious individuals building a community of people who want to achieve success in every aspect of our lives, and we encourage employees to figure out how they can use Expensify to realize their personal goals with the support of the company around them.) How did you hear about us? A job posting? Chalk on a sidewalk? From a friend? Let us know where you saw this opening. Resume not your thing? That’s great, we don’t really read them anyway! Forward your responses to the questions to apply@expensify.com. Were excited to hear from you!

title: Product Designer
description: Who We AreNess is an early-stage, remote-first startup at the unique intersection of fintech and healthcare. We’re on a mission to build a world where everyone can afford to get and stay healthy.We’re fresh off a $15.5M seed round and funded by some of the most iconic operators and entrepreneurs in the space (e.g. Sweetgreen, Headspace, One Medical, Thrive Market).Started by the former CEO & Founder of Greatist (acquired by Healthline in 2019), were building an AmEx-like credit card for health. We’ve got enormous ambitions to flip healthcare on its head through an alternative to health insurance that rewards consumers for the right behaviors and brings down the cost of healthcare.What Impact You Can MakeAs a product designer on our Design team, you’ll be crafting a revolutionary health and finance experience that has the potential to change healthcare forever.In this role, you’ll drive discovery, research, ideation, and design of the product, as well as partner with engineering and product management to ship new experiences.This role sits within the Design team, under the Experience pillar.You May Be The Ideal Candidate If YouIf you don’t meet 100% of the below qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying. We take a holistic approach to evaluating talent for our team. Have 4-5 years of experience in product design, with work thats made its way into consumer-facing software (ideally, iOS). Have a design portfolio that showcases your eye for good visual design and attention to detail. Are a systems-thinker and can see beyond the pixels. Are highly collaborative in a remote-first environment and enjoy sharing work early and often. Are able to manage your work autonomously and comfortable with the pace that comes with an early-stage startup. Are a wizard in Figma (bonus points for motion design). Are a self-starter—there’s always something you want to do, learn, and grow in as a designer. Have a bachelor’s degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product), Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. Things You Might Do Design and shape the product experience into something truly magical. Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to identify new opportunities and envision creative solutions. Act as the champion for the user experience, clearly articulating design rationale internally and externally. Evolve our design process and standards such that it inspires and influences the work of others across the company. Support the team in constant experimentation through data and user feedback to improve the user experience and product. Empower engineers to get the fit and finish right. Our Core ValuesWe arent a family, were an incredible team. At Ness, our core values are the source of our POWER.✏️ Pencil It InWe move fast, try new things fearlessly, think differently, and learn from our mistakes.🙏🏼 One NessWere all on the same team, have short memories, plus can disagree and commit.🥓 Work CrispyWe value clear, rigorous thought, give regular feedback, and were always prepared.🦕 Embrace Your Mythical CreatureOur differences make us special. Come as you are (but no trolls, please!)👏🏽 Right Way To Win (Not The Easy Way)We believe in doing well AND doing good.How We HireFirst, we dont discriminate. We know from experience that a more diverse and inclusive team leads to bigger impact and success.1. First HelloYoull talk to our CXO & Co-Founder, Kenneth for 15-30 minutes. Theres nothing to prepare in advance.First, we want to figure out if youve got the right experience for this position and if working at Ness is a fit for you and us. Well have reviewed your portfolio in detail, so this discussion will be mostly a behavioral interview focused on what youve done before. We want to build conviction that youll succeed in this job the same way youve succeeded in the past.Then, youll have time to ask us anything! (Well, mostly anything.)2. The Jam SeshAfter this, well schedule a design jam with Kenneth and potentially other Ness team members. Why? We believe collaboration is a key skill for designers in a remote-first company—and we want a chance to see you in action. Well share more details about this when we get there!3. Portfolio ReviewNext, you’ll have a chance to share 2-3 of your past projects and go deep on them. Here, we’re trying to understand your approach to design projects and see your craft in detail. We also want to learn how you frame the problem, how you articulate your process and decisions, and what explorations you considered prior to arriving at the final solution.4. Meet the TeamYoull meet other team members via a series of 30-60 minute 1:1’s including our CEO & Founder, Derek. Here, we want to explore if were a good fit for each other. We also want to learn what brings out the best in you and whats next. We want to be confident Ness can offer the environment (culture, responsibility, org structure, etc.) thats led you to the most professional success so far.Youll have time to ask questions, too!5. ReferencesOh—and, with your help, well reach out to folks youve worked with in the past. Were usually pretty far along here, so this is mostly about learning from outside perspectives about how to manage and empower you best.6. The Job OfferGot this far? That means youre in. Expect a personal call from Kenneth or Derek and welcome to the team!No recruiters or agencies, please. Thanks!

title: FT Contract Designer
