description: Product Design & Innovation Lab dedicated to launching forward-thinking products and technologies to market.At Aither, were looking for a talented designer to join our team! The ideal candidate will have expert knowledge of current design software and be skilled in every step of the design process, from concept to final deliverable. We are currently in stealth, are very agile, and work primarily on AI and AR powered applications.Required skills and qualifications Exceptional creativity and innovative design skills Design Systems (Atomic Design) Excellent communication and presentation skills Organizational and time-management skills for meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment UI design experience UX Research Graphic Design Proficiency with Photoshop and Illustrator required Must include portfolio to apply. Remote-friendly and New York based. MUST be able to work EST or PST timezone if abroad.

title: SuperAI brand and website
description: SuperAI (www.superai.com), taking place 28-29 February 2024, is the most anticipated AI conference that will define the future of artificial intelligence.Industry leaders, heads of state, entrepreneurs, renowned researchers, and curious minds alike will converge at the iconic Marina Bay Sands in Singapore to explore and unveil the next wave of transformative AI technologies.Organised by the team behind TOKEN2049, SuperAI is built on over 5 years of event management experience that has brought together 20,000+ attendees to shape the future of frontier technologies.Creative scope and briefWith a date, venue, and success criteria set, SuperAI also has initial brand assets defined; these include:· Brand name· Brand tag line· Logo design· Website content wireframe We are looking for a Brand Developer to evolve SuperAI’s brand identity based on these initial assets. The deliverables are a) a brand book and b) a website design, which can be adapted to build a website using a no-code, drag & drop editor such as Wix. The assets to be defined include:· Brand colours· Font· Imagery· Iconography· Design assets· Image library· Specific language, if necessary· The adaptation of these into a brand book· The adaptation of these as a website mockupAs a starting point, the SuperAI logo files and the website content wireframe should be leveraged.Timelines, next steps, budgetThe start time is immediate, and the project should be handed over within 4 weeks, within a budget of $10,000. As the website has an urgent requirement to go live, the top priority asset will be the website hero section, which should be handed over within 2 weeks - the remainder of the assets can be handed over upon project completion.Please submit an initial design proposal of the website hero section by email to website@superai.com – the SuperAI team will reach out to you to discuss your proposal if selected.We look forward to working with you!

title: Product Design Manager - UX/UI
description: ClubRare is a fast-moving startup on a mission to reinvent and redefine the social commerce market for the digital age and to empower both creators and collectors. Through the use of Web3 technology and Phygital NFTs, the platform will connect collectors and creators directly, blurring the boundaries between the real world and the Metaverse.We are a fully remote company with no fixed headquarters. As a distributed company, we embrace a diverse and inclusive culture that transcends geographical borders. Our team members come from all over the world and bring a rich array of experiences, perspectives, and lifestyles to the team.Our team thrives on six core values: Integrity, always acting ethically; Intentionality, working purposefully; Empathy, understanding others; Resilience, overcoming challenges; Insight, bringing awareness; and Analysis, making data-driven decisions.We seek individuals who embody these principles, contribute unique perspectives, and are ready to make a meaningful impact. If this sounds like you - come join us if you are looking to disrupt.Responsibilities: Design and shape the UX and UI strategy of our new social commerce platform. Leading the design team in all directions. Develop and conceptualize a comprehensive UX/UI design strategy for ClubRare. Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes. Design new UI elements and tools. Test UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages. Collaborate with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the Web3 digital user. Provide advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyze and predict user behavior. Adhere to style standards in typography and graphic design. Requirements 4-5 years experience in UX/UI design, publications, and/or designing for tech companies. Previous experience working in a product company, including involvement in product operations. Extensive experience in both web and mobile design. A deep understanding of user-centered design principles and methods. Strong typography and color knowledge and fundamentals. Ability to prototype rapidly, and take in team & customer feedback within the process. Experience in design strategy, in addition to execution, is a plus. Proficiency in design and prototype development tools like Figma, Sketch, Adobe, etc. A knack for grasping concepts and products quickly and his ability to self govern Experience with blockchaiWeb3 or fintech or a demonstrated learning interest. A desire and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. As a fully remote organization, we strive for efficient collaboration. Despite our geographic diversity, we all operate and coordinate synchronously within these specified time zones: CEST, EST, and KST. This practice allows us to synergize effectively with your core team and ensure seamless operations. What we offer you: A unique opportunity to be part of the growing crypto/NFT community early on, making a meaningful impact on the team as well as the world The annual salary for this position ranges from $100,000.00 to $170,000.00. The actual annual salary paid for this position will be based on several factors, including but not limited to, skills, prior experiences, training, company needs, and current market demands. The annual salary range for this position is subject to change and may be adjusted in the future. This position may also be eligible for salary increases, bonuses, and benefits. Flexible, remote work with a high degree of autonomy in a dynamic, fast-growth startup. An opportunity to leverage bleeding-edge technology and industry-leading development practices. At ClubRare, we believe that talent knows no boundaries. Our company is built on a foundation of collaboration and teamwork, and we believe that the best ideas can come from anywhere, thats why we encourage you to apply, no matter where you are located.We are committed to creating a work environment that is inclusive and welcoming to all. As an equal-opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic. We believe that diversity is a source of strength and all qualified candidates will be given equal consideration for employment at ClubRare.

title: Art Director / Creative Director
description: Say Hello to MilaClean air is one of the four basic necessities of life, yet most of us are airblivious. At Mila, our mission is to bring every family back from airblivion and shape the healthy home of the future.Mila Cares, Inc. is a San Francisco-based consumer electronics startup, with a fully distributed team around the world. Mila was started by three dads who wanted better for their own kids, turning a passion project into something that now powers more than 200 million hours of cleaner air (and counting) each year for families everywhere. We are backed by the late Paul Allen’s venture capital arm, Vulcan Capital, and two of the largest consumer brands in the world, including Electrolux. Our first product was a record-setting hit on Kickstarter, generating nearly $2M in pre-orders and winning TIME Magazine’s Best Inventions of 2021. Our second product won the CES 2022 Innovation Award in Home Electronics. We have a lot more in the pipeline and are looking for the next generation of talented, thoughtful leaders to help us bring these to market.At Mila we use the word “thoughtful” in everything we do – from our mission, to our product decisions, to our customer and team interactions. We know our customers buy our products for the health of their loved ones and we take that responsibility seriously.The RoleAs Milas founding art director, you’ll have the opportunity to guide the visual narrative for a refreshingly thoughtful brand – one whose brand mission is to cure the world of airblivion, helping every family breathe easier, and live healthier. We’ll look to you to help evolve our brand story, and work closely with the team to develop and execute on a creative strategy that’s inspiring, measurable and scalable. .Key Responsibilities You’ll help steer the creative ship by setting a consistent look and feel. Developing and executing on a creative strategy that can support the brand’s growth goals, with a keen understanding of how platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Google, video, TV, etc. work. Manage and prioritize multiple workstreams and ensure all deliverables consistently reflect our brand voice. In your first 60 days, you’ll work on building key assets and setting up a process that allows for rapid creative iteration. Key Qualifications 5+ years of creative/brand work, having taken brands from inception to household names. You know what it takes to both tell and amplify a great story. Youre someone where design just courses through your veins :) You know what it takes to put together visuals that stand on their own and tell a story. You’re able to present a portfolio of work that highlights your understanding of innovative tech trends (and not being afraid to lean into it), an impeccable command of delivering strong creative, and an innate understanding of what makes something “sticky” Your written and verbal communication skills are second to none, and you can clearly paint both the larger creative vision as well as get into the nitty gritty of what’s needed to make it happen. Experience building and leading a creative team, and fostering a constructive feedback loop that pushes everyone to do their best creative work and let the best ideas rise to the top. A curious, growth driven mindset. You’re always looking for ways to improve and delight, and putting the customer at the core of your process. Empathy — most importantly, you care, and love creating thoughtful, personal experiences at scale. To apply, please fill out this brief questionnaire -- youll also have an opportunity to include your portfolio: https://bit.ly/mila-art-director

title: Visual Designer
description: The RoleAs a visual designer at Alchemy, youll get to help define how the world views our brand and build. Youll work cross-functionally to build Alchemys global visual identity across our international user base with a focus on the future. Every piece of work you ship will be viewed by millions across major news outlets such as Bloomberg, New York Times, Wired, and the largest blockchain media outlets.Responsibilities Deliver delightful digital assets to all functions of the company, including leadership, marketing, communications, and engineering Lead the creative process from conception to creation across a wide breadth of use cases Help evolve the Alchemy brand Work on important investor presentations/decks, landing pages, and graphic compositions for blogs, newsletters, and more marketing efforts Iterate on design based on feedback from the greater team Maintain a high-quality threshold with regards to the Alchemy brand What Were Looking For 5+ years of experience as a visual designer, within a digital agency/studio or in-house, tech-related Inclusive of proven ability to design and deliver high-quality brand, marketing collateral Ability to ideate, conceptualize and sketch your design proposals Ability to take your concepts through to final production-ready Design-driven, but a strategy-led approach to executing visuals concepts Exceptional eye for design with a good pulse on current trends and best practices Thrive on multitasking on a wide range of subjects and projects You understand how to work to tight deadlines, over multiple projects, engage with multiple teams and deliver quality throughout everything you design. You take immense pride in your work and you strive to improve continuously over every project you work on. Proficient in Figma, Adobe CC suite (PS, AI & AE), Webflow (not essential but beneficial) You are passionate about shape, color, typography and have demonstrable knowledge of how to apply this. Passion for blockchain technologies is a plus Required: Work should be reflected in an amazing portfolio

title: UX Director (Freelance)
description: UX Director (Freelance)Work on groundbreaking products from the comfort of your home or during your travels abroad. Were looking for Freelance UX Directors to work with our New York and San Francisco Teams. Fantasy is building a freelance bench of the best design talent across the world to enable us to flex our design capability for clients when needed.Join our team A UX Director at Fantasy works to ship world-class products for pioneering companies. You will oversee talented teams and work hands-on with organizations to create future experiences that might range from global mobile OSs to web.Responsibilities Lead a team of talented designers Combine oversight with hands-on work Work end-to-end to ship great products Develop strong working relationships with clients Qualifications Proven experience in defining user experiences for a variety of applications, products, and platforms Strong communication skills, both written and oral, with the natural ability to articulate and defend design decisions Attention to detail Ability to excite and engage those around you to bring about the best outcomes Professional Experience 8+ years of experience in creative and digital agencies Experience leading the creation of digital products and platforms A portfolio showcasing innovative design solutions across a breadth of business verticals Checklist You have an online portfolio Youre ready to both lead and to learn You can work with our US Based Teams

title: Short Product Launch Video
description: Hi, I work in an insurance brokerage called Genesis Insurance Brokers based in Trinidad. On July 1st we will be celebrating our 5th anniversary and would like to launch a product called Genesis Elite. Its basically a membership card giving you access to discounts, treatments etc. We would like to develop a short product launch video (<2 minutes) We have the brochures and product details. Is this something you can complete before July 1st?

title: User Experience Designer
description: Anonyome Labs is creating a world in which people have exclusive control over their personal data.We’re changing the privacy and cybersafety paradigm—and resolving the greatest challenges consumers and enterprises face.Through our products, MySudo consumer app and Sudo Platform business privacy toolkit, we empower everyday users to decide when, where and with whom they share their personal information, and we help enterprises rapidly develop and deploy branded privacy and cybersafety solutions for their customers.In developing the Sudo digital identity at the heart of our products, we wanted to do something that hasn’t been done before — because that’s what the global fight for data privacy will demand from us all: out of the box thinking and .If you want to join us at the leading edge of data privacy, apply to join our team now. There’s never been a better time.Anonyome Labs is looking for a Product (UX) Designer to partner closely with product managers, designers, marketers and engineers to build and ship creative solutions and experiences for our consumer, mobile and desktop applications. You’ll design workflows, interactions, prototypes, and visuals that are thoughtful and practical, impacting Anonyome, our customers, and their customers.Requirements: 4+ plus years of product based UX design experience working on complex iOS, Android, desktop and web apps. Has a portfolio of work demonstrating skills in visual design, UI design, interaction design, prototyping/testing, user research and information architecture. In-depth experience with Sketch and the Adobe Creative Suite. A strong understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines and Material Design. Own the design process for your team’s features, including research, validation, and iteration. Partner with product managers and engineers to oversee the user experience of a product from concept to launch. Ability to communicate and present your work (from sketches to final products) and articulate your design decisions to stakeholders for review and feedback. Effectively manage projects to meet deadlines, roadmaps, and requirements; be able to keep projects on track and progressing despite setbacks and unforeseen issues. The prioritization skills that let you work on many projects at once while maintaining commitments. Added Bonus Graphic design, traditional print, illustration and or photography understanding a plus. HTML & CSS skills are a plus Finally, we expect you to score extremely high on our Stuff That Matters:Enhancing Privacy Privacy is at Our CoreGrowing as One team Work Inclusively, Embrace Diversity, Succeed TogetherSharing Insights Information empowers our decision makingTaking Ownership Own it, enjoy it, learn from itFeeding Curiosity Always learning**Hybrid work options available for remote and in-office located in Lehi, UT**We offer health, dental, vision & life insurance plans, unlimited PTO, remote work, equity, catered lunches, and an exciting and innovative atmosphere. If you’re interested in changing the world, we’d love to talk to you.

title: Creative UX Designer and CRO-Specialist
description: This is not a normal job.Were looking for a designer constrained by logic/reason in their design; focused on the minimal viable solution to create the desired impact; and which has a fundamental understanding of conversion-optimization techniques. It could be as few as 3 hrs/wk, but the sky is the limit as ROI drives us. But thats not important yet.How about we start here: Normal Job: Your boss tells you what to do. Your boss tells you how to do it. Nadine West: You decide what to do based on our goals. We figure out how to do it. You change the company.What Is The Role?We prefer not to box you into a specific label. We dont want to confuse skills with jobs.How do you do your job?1. Identify Problems (whats holding us back from hitting our goals) 2. Solve Problems (as fast as you can)What You Bring To The TableYou love the art and science of design (typography, tools, flow, aesthetics). You love the thrill of increasing conversion-rate. Its like a game. We trust your logical decision-making. Youll have the freedom to gather insights, talk to users, look at data. Your ideas are only as good as the effects they produce on the user-behavior. We dont design for the sake of design. We design for the user. LEADER We want you to lead. You dont follow direction, you create direction. Push our pace. You accept nothing less than the A-game of those around you. Call B.S. when you see it. Sloppy execution = B.S. Opinions w/o Evidence = B.S. Lets call each other out. SCALE Were a lean team. Every person wears many hats. Youll need to as well.This Is Interesting. Now What?Talk is cheap. Interviews are incredibly difficult to discern good fits. Historic work is good, but not perfect. We try to run a very short, paid test to cover the gap (3-5 hrs of work). If you test, interpret the instructions as you see fit. Better yet, let us know why the test is dumb and what the actual test should be. We want you to demonstrate your best self: How you identify and solve problems How fantastic your intuition is (even with your minimal exposure to us) The dynamic range of your skills (why youre not just an artistic designer)

title: Senior UI-UX Designer
description: Hey!We are RĀNADEV, a design and development agency based out of Seattle, WA. From concept to buildout, we make game-changing applications with industry leading UX and hella-good code.We’re looking for REALLY COOL product designers to work on cutting edge projects in the AI, Web3, Fintech and Blockchain space.THE SPECIFICS UI designer who is proficient in SKETCH and or FIGMA Excellent product design and design fundamentals, including visual design, typography, UI design, interaction design, and information architecture Able to provide both Desktop AND mobile of each design Also VERY good at UX and creating user experience that is new and pushes the limits of what exists Is able to create high-fidelity motion prototypes of designs, both in small animations and entire application using After Effects Needs to design the UI as part of the UX together, and not start with wireframes Last, need to be communicative and available for conversation. Communication is EXTREMELY important POSITIONYoull be Senior Product Designer (Full-time Independent Contractor) working directly for RĀNADEV in a remote position. Well be offering you an awesome and competitive payout that is well above the industry standards for this role.HOW TO APPLYKindly send your responses to the following questions to kartik@ranadev.io ALONG WITH the link to your portfolio. On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you with designing in Sketch? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you with designing in Figma? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you in turning your designs into motion prototypes? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you in turning your designs into motion prototypes using Adobe After Effects? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you in using a 3D package like Blender/Cinema 4D? If you had specifications, how many hours would it take you to create a dashboard from scratch in Sketch or Figma? Do you have experience handing your designs off to front end developers and making sure that they are executed properly? Are you OK with a bi-monthly payout for a full-time position? What is your hourly rate? THE PROCESSStep 1: You apply for the position and send the answers to the questions above to kartik@ranadev.io along with the link to you portfolio.Step 2: Well screen the candidates for an interview based on the responses to the questions above and the portfolio.Step 3: Youll be sent a Zoom invite for a video interview where well get to know each other even better!Step 4: Well contact you back within 24 hours with your offer.Step 5: Onboarding! 🥳

title: Senior Product Designer
description: DescriptionAbout MurmurationMurmuration is a nonprofit organization focused on leveraging civic engagement to drive greater equity. We are committed to transforming public education so that every child – regardless of who they are or where they live – can benefit from the same opportunities afforded by a quality education.We provide sophisticated tools, data, strategic guidance, and programmatic support to help our partner organizations increase civic engagement and marshal support to drive change at the community level. Our best-in-class data and easy-to-use tools have been used by hundreds of organizations to make informed decisions about who they need to reach and how to achieve and sustain impact – and to put those decisions into action.Our team includes experts and innovators in data, analytics, and strategy. We are former teachers, organizers, data scientists, and campaign veterans, and we are looking for people whose passion and expertise can help realize our vision.Note: At Murmuration, we are committed to becoming an even more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. To this end, all staff members are expected to actively participate in DEI (diversity, equity, inclusion) programming.About the RoleThis is a full-time position reporting to our Manager of UX Design and joining a close-knit group of Product Designers.As a Senior Product Designer, you will play a pivotal role in determining the look, feel, and user experience for one of our products within a growing product portfolio including enterprise software tools and mobile apps. You’ll dive into the weeds wherever needed within your product Pod to help keep the team moving. Based on the business and product context, constraints, and requirements, you’ll focus on designing what drives the most impact: innovating where it drives a key outcome and building from prior learnings to avoid reinventing the wheel.What You’ll Do: Effectively and empathically collaborate with cross-functional teams of researchers, product managers, engineers, marketers, and data scientists; Advocate for and employ user-centered design methodologies to thoroughly understand customer goals and pain points, and help others do the same; Design early-stage product ideas, learn from experiments, iterate quickly to propose new hypotheses, and deliver actionable insights to your team; Deliver end-to-end feature design work, including user journeys and flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes; Regularly present designs to stakeholders for feedback and to the company at large Mentor and collaborate with other designers to apply best practices, learn cutting edge techniques, and coordinate on a rich product ecosystem; and Help drive continuous improvement of our design practice from tools to process to team culture RequirementsWhat You Should Have Passion for civic engagement, campaigns, and equitability; Excellent product design fundamentals, including visual design, UI design, interaction design, and information architecture; Demonstrable real-world design expertise in complex SaaS products on teams using Agile software development methodologies; Skill in strategizing at a high level then breaking down and targeting the tactical pieces to realize the vision in a phased approach; Expertise in creating and using design systems to drive consistency and reusability throughout a suite of products; Deep understanding of accessibility and responsive/adaptive design to accommodate different form factors; A bias for action and the ability to thrive working in fast-paced climates (e.g., start-up or similar); A strong commitment to data-driven decision making: welcoming both qualitative and quantitative data on the impact of our products to enrich the iterative design process; Mastery of industry-standard design and collaboration tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Jira, and Miro (or equivalent); and A portfolio that showcases how you designed real world solutions and the role you played in bringing them to life (online is preferred). What you could have: Experience with CRMs, political or advocacy campaigns, and/or civic organizing products; Experience with analytics tools such as Pendo, Mixpanel, Fullstory, Google Analytics, or similar; Design expertise in data visualization; Visual identity branding experience; and/or Training in behavioral science (RCTs, interventions, etc.) Talented Senior Product Designers come from all walks of life and career. If you are passionate about civic engagement and technology, please apply, even if you do not check every box!BenefitsLocation, Compensation, and BenefitsThe Senior Product Designer is a full-time, salaried position with a comprehensive benefits package. It is based anywhere in the U.S. The salary range for this position is $115,000 - $135,000 and is commensurate with experience.An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to DiversityMurmuration is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally of race, gender, color, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation, and national origin. We reasonably accommodate staff members and/or applicants with disabilities, provided they are otherwise able to perform the essential functions of the job.

title: Product Designer
description: This is a remote role open in EMEAWho we areWe are Kisi, a physical security technology company that accelerates a world where the right people can share physical resources at any time. Founded in 2012, Kisi operates from a headquarter in Brooklyn (USA), an office in Stockholm (Sweden), and a remote team across the globe.What we doWe bring simple and secure physical security to people and organizations anywhere. Our award-winning hardware and compliance-certified software form the core of our physical security platform that helps businesses around the world connect and control their spaces through the cloud. With our seamless access experience and real-time data and analytics we help make spaces available to the right people at any time. But don’t just take our word for it: explore our award-winning Reader Pro, which recently won the coveted GOOD DESIGN award as well as the prestigious iF Design Award. Curious about how Kisi works? Check out this short product demo.How and why we do itAt Kisi, you will have the freedom to do your work in the way you work best. There’s a flat hierarchy (work alongside our co-founders Carl, Max, and Bernie!), a strong sense of ownership, and the freedom to get creative. We also try to limit meetings as much as possible, so you can have dedicated focus time. Our mission is clear: ensure ease of facility access and remote space management, providing access systems to create a secure future where spaces are connected and accessible without boundaries.Your roleWe are looking for a talented individual to join our team and shape the user experience for our mobile and web apps, used globally by hundreds of thousands of admins and end users. Your creativity and analytical skills will be utilized to deliver best-in-class experiences (UX and UI) that are seamless, intuitive, efficient, and exciting. Your responsibilitiesResponsibilities include owning the user experience for our mobile and web applications, conducting competitive and user research, gathering feedback, and working closely with our product managers, UI designer, and developers to implement your ideas. You are expected to contribute to design work (UI) as well, so a few years of experience with working with tools like Figma to build user interfaces and other visual deliverables is required.We strive to move fast and want everyone to make an impact as early as possible. In your first 30 days, you will develop a deep understanding of your context, and in your first 90 days, you will work with the product management team to identify three areas for improvement and present tangible results. Your qualifications You share our values: forward, human, trusted, and responsible. You have worked, in-depth, with user experience and relevant research before, as part of an agency or a product company. You are highly proficient with graphical design tools like Figma to craft interfaces and other visual deliverables. You have a passion for technology. Our products are technical in nature. What you can expect Impact. It’s all about making a positive impact on people’s everyday lives. At Kisi, you are expected to make meaningful contributions to shape the future of physical security. Excellence. We strive for excellence and best-in-class experiences in everything we do. We are innovative and obsessed with the details that matter. Culture. Our culture is not a written manifest, but the result of all of us. We place great emphasis on building a company that is open, welcoming, challenging and fun. Ownership. We don’t believe in micro-management, but we do believe in setting and getting goals. At Kisi, you will own goals, and have freedom under responsibility. Diversity. We are American, Argentinian, Brazilian, Danish, English, Ethiopian, German, Indian, Nigerian, Swedish, and more. Learn more about who we are and our Values.Your benefits Team offsites. The Kisi Krew meets up from time to time in person in new exciting locations. Equipment. You will be set up with all the necessary equipment to do your job to the best of your ability. Vacation days. Sweden: minimum 25 days PTO. USA and Remote: minimum 20 days PTO. Healthcare and pension. USA: health coverage, 401k. Sweden: health coverage, life insurance, pension plan. Remote: build your own package. Grow with us. We are here to support you in your growth whether you want to become a manager, learn a new skill, or move into a new role.Referral program. You will get $2.500 for each successful hire we make from your referrals.What’s not to like? Send in your application, free up your calendar, and lets talk!Your process with usApplication > CV screening > Intro call (let’s get to know each other!) > Recruitment task > Technical Interview > Culture Interview > Offer > Background check

title: Product Designer
description: ABOUT FLOWNFLOWN is a mission-driven startup dedicated to enhancing focus, creativity, and fulfilment in work life.With so many online and offline distractions, we are eroding our ability to focus at work, and the move to remote work driven by COVID has meant people have lost the workplace rituals and human connection that provided accountability, novelty, and meaning.Using the science behind deep work and flow states, FLOWN has created a platform offering live focus sessions, led by charismatic facilitators, to deliver focus, accountability and community to distracted professionals everywhere.FLOWN is led by serial entrepreneur Alicia Navarro, who founded content monetization platform Skimlinks (acquired by Connexity April 2021) and was Chair of proptech platform Yourkeys (acquired by Zoopla June 2021).ABOUT THE ROLEOne of FLOWNs core values is a deep appreciation for good design and seamless flow, and its importance in imbuing moments with delight, beauty, ease, and clarity.As our Product Designer, you won’t just shape our platforms aesthetic; you’ll directly influence our user’s ability to work effectively and enjoyably, and develop healthy habits that make their lives better. Your design will be at the heart of our mission, making the FLOWN brand synonymous with ease, beauty, and productivity.We are particularly interested in a designer who has a keen interest or experience in behavioural science and habit formation. You will have the chance to apply these principles to create user interfaces that not only look great but also promote positive work habits and enhance user productivity.RESPONSIBILITIESHeres some of things youll be responsible for: Lead the design function, shaping the visual and interactive identity of FLOWN. Collaborate closely with our Product Director and Founder to conceptualise, design, and refine the features of the FLOWN platform. Your input will be essential to our products direction and evolution. Work with our Product Director to conduct discovery and user research, map out our use cases, user personas, and various customer journeys. Actively engage with our Tech team to ensure they have all the designs, specifications and assets needed and participate in acceptance testing to ensure high visual and UX standards. Design the user interface and user experience of all features and interactions on our website and platform. Create and rapidly iterate prototypes at various levels of fidelity, turning ideas and concepts from sketches and wireframes into development-ready specifications. Manage and enrich our platform design system and asset library. Ensure the FLOWN brand design is consistently represented across all the work we produce, from decks to documents to interface design to customer collateral. Stay abreast of competitors, other great visual brands, new trends, and best practices in order to bring this perspective into your rationale for features, design concepts and UX decisions. REQUIREMENTSWe think you’ll need the following experience in order to succeed in the role: 3+ years of experience as a UI/UX designer. Experience with both visual/graphic design experience alongside wireframing & user flows. Highly proficient in Figma Exposure designing for B2C community products advantageous. Experience working within an early-stage business is preferable. In addition, here are the core attributes we think youll need to succeed in the role: Creative, passionate, a strong aesthetic, and sound judgement - you create unique, beautiful, clean and engaging designs. You are excited by our mission and use this passion to create user experiences that will drive value. You are the champion of what good looks like, and you use this skill to make wise empathetic decisions, and to guide others in the same way. Collaborative - you understand that product design touches upon all teams, as well as our members and hosts. You proactively and constructively share your opinions, plans and insights with team members, and you regularly solicit the views and needs of others - be they internal team members or users of FLOWN. Product mindset - you understand how to observe and extract information about what customers want from a product. You use these insights to evolve our product and its UI in a way that keeps them happy, engaged, and retained. Organised and resilient - you thrive in a fast-paced team, prioritise a busy workload, juggle multiple tasks, and work to quick-turnaround deadlines. You are unfazed when theres a lot on your plate or curveballs are thrown your way. BENEFITSWe want to practice what we preach, and build a company and team that works creatively and productively. Here are some of the benefits youll gain from this role: Scope and influence - youre joining the founding team and will be involved in shaping our product, what we do, and how we work. A focus on deep work - we exist to support deep work among our members, so we support our staff in developing their own distraction-free deep work practice. A strong team - we are led by a proven CEO & Founder, and the rest of the team is equally highly experienced. We also have a high-calibre of investors with a good amount of member traction already. Fully dispersed, flexible working - we are a remote-first company, and weve got lots of perks, tools and processes to make sure that works for everyone. We encourage individuals to establish working hours that enable them to work as productively as possible, and we understand that everyone needs a work/life balance. Team socials - we get together regularly to collaborate and have fun. We also embed virtual activities and other surprises into our working days. Stock options - you’ll own a part of the company, so its success will be your own too.

title: Product Designer - UI/UX
description: CryptoHub offers a variety of high-quality, one-of-a-kind crypto trading tools and innovations to improve the average crypto traders experience and safety when trading crypto.At CryptoHub, traders can utilize a range of resources, including a tool that performs sophisticated data analysis of every token on the blockchain, a smart contract builder, and launchpads.We are seeking an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team.Working hours - preferably GMT+2 time zone, 9 hours a day (or more if want).What we seek:1. 3+ years experience specifically in web/apps design.2. Extensive experience with Figma which includes:• knows how to work with Atomic design• Knows HIG and Google Material Design• knows how to manage Design Systems• experience in working with CSS libraries like: Bootstrap, Base, Carbon, HIG, Google Material Design)• knowing Figma: autolayout, components, shared libraries, components properties.• basic knowledge of HTML, CSS (optional).3. English level - good / can talk and understand decently.Must add a link to portfolio.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: We are looking for a part-time product designer with experience building mobile products. We are looking to bring cutting edge generative AI to the business users.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: About the opportunityWe’re looking for a seasoned, versatile product designer to join our team as we build a world-class platform to power live event experiences around the world.This role works continuously alongside cross-functional teams of PMs and developers to shape products that are simple, polished, and thoughtful. We love folks that bring an intrapreneurial energy and thrive in an iterative and fluid product development environment. If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.The core of what you’ll be doing Own and craft the end-to-end user journey and product design execution – from concepts and prototyping to testing and delivery. Consistently uphold the quality and craft of design through all points of the user experience. Partner with Product and Engineering leads and other supporting teams to shape and execute design strategy. Articulate the narrative of your design solutions to stakeholders, partners and peers. What we’ll look for in you You’re a great listener and communicator. Your work is precise, thoughtful, refined and polished. You have at least 8+ years leading product and UI design in a professional role. Your strong portfolio shows you’ve had a central design role in shipping products to real customers. You’ve got an ability to articulate your design decisions to others with clarity and thoughtful reasoning. You have a natural inclination to seek feedback, ask smart questions and absorb different perspectives from Research, Product and Engineering to develop a well-reasoned design approach. You’re fluent in Figma and component-based design methods. You’ve got strong prototyping skills. You show as well as tell. You are versatile across platforms and form factors – from native mobile apps to web, small screens to large. We’d love you to have… A habit of continuous learning. An action-oriented, builder mindset. Constructive feedback skills that make everyone around you better. An all-around positive attitude! Benefits Work where you live. This is a remote position. Join our team from where you are. Generous paid time off. It’s important to take care of yourself (and those that depend on you). Family Leave policy. Healthcare coverage. We offer competitive health, dental and vision coverage, and a range of other benefits. Find community. Our Employee Resource Groups help foster a culture of diversity, support and inclusivity. About the division & teamOur Digital Growth group lives at the intersection of technology, content, and events, operating scaled businesses and creating new direct-to-consumer offerings with the world’s best creative talent and brands at the center. We are a team of product managers, designers, engineers and data scientists focused on building cutting-edge products that help shape an engaging future for events.More about EndeavorEndeavor is a global media and entertainment company with world-class brands and capabilities across talent representation, sports, fashion, event management, and brand marketing. Comprised of industry leaders including entertainment agency WME; sports, fashion, events, and media company IMG; and premier mixed martial arts organization UFC, Endeavor likely plays a significant role in the content you love and the experiences and events that you never forget. Our companies and represented talent and brand clients collectively reach billions of passionate fans, directly, every single day.Endeavor is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Product Designer
description: The Product Designer will be part of the Experience Design team which works on Product Design at Plutus — between Web app, Android and iOS App. And since Plutus’s main audience is our community and app users, we agonize over and take pride in crafting user-friendly and user-focused experiences.If you feel this could be of interest, come in for a chat! We like bright minds.Responsibilities Work closely with engineers and product managers to work on core banking and payment features for Plutus’s iOS and Android app taking it to next level Advocate for best user experience on core perks and subscription tiers. Able to go deep on details and also comfortable zooming out and seeing big picture and connecting the dots Initiate and run user research team, drive and support UX research projects using tools such as Maze or Usertesting.com Participate in design reviews and share your work regularly with the design and company leadership Understand the array of technical constraints, user goals, and business requirements that shape a product- understand principles and tradeoffs. Structure and facilitate ideation workshops for an emerging product category Requirements 3-5 years of lived product designer experience - fintech experience preferred Interested in crypto / digital assets a must Familiar with native mobile design patterns on Android and iOS and gave designed polished apps for both platforms Have an exceptional portfolio demonstrating strong product and visual design sensibilities and experience in creating concepts, customer journeys, specifying interaction details, and prototyping internally and with users Knowledge of asset implementation standards on iOS, Android, and Web (we use Figma) Committed to user-first mindset and interested in crafting excellent user experiences Preference for experience design Exhibits our core values: do the right thing, consistently ship and know what good looks like

title: Sr. UX/UI Designer
description: Type: Contract-to-Hire or ConsultingLocation: United States (Within the Continental United States Only) - Fully Remote - Preferably able to work within the EST time zone﻿Title: Sr. UX/UI DesignerAlternate Title: Product DesignerPOSITION SUMMARYResponsible for creating and designing user interfaces that optimize user interaction and experience. Support testing activities and incorporate findings todevelop visual/interactive solutions. Provide day-to-day support of product teams. Demonstrate the company’s core values of respect, honesty, integrity,diversity, inclusion and safety.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Collaborate on scenarios, end-to-end experiences, prototypes and other artifacts to help teams align on problems and solutions Define visual elements, product elements and overall design Create and implement interaction models and user interface specifications Evaluate and set best practices and standards Share artifacts with team members and stakeholders, and incorporate feedback as appropriate Support associate product designers and development teams during technical implementation Monitor user engagement and identify opportunities for improvement and innovation Champion company standards and best practices and ensure that assignments are delivered with the highest of quality and in accordance to standards Serve as an advocate for collaboration and assist other team members on assignments Embrace Agile environment and act as an advocate for customers, providing strategic leadership based in user-centered design, user research, customer analytics, and business goals Apply standards from design systems and/or brand guidelines, and contribute to design systems Travel to local campuses and to attend company meetings MINIMUM POSITION QUALIFICATIONS 3+ years of experience in Digital/UI Design or related field Any experience in an Agile software environment Proficient using design and authoring tools such as Sketch, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Invision In–depth understanding of UI; knowledge of latest design trends and their role in the commercial environment Ability to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail Portfolio demonstrating previous experience in UI and problem-solving approaches Ability to make deliberate, customer driven design decisions that translate high-level requirements into thoughtful, intuitive, functional interfaces BEHAVIORS/SKILLSPUTS THE CUSTOMER FIRST:Anticipates customer needs, champions for the customer, acts with customers in mind, exceeds customers’ expectations, gains customers’ trust and respect.COMMUNICATES EFFECTIVELY AND CANDIDLY:Communicates clearly and directly, approachable, relates well to others, engages people and helps them understand change, provides and seeks feedback,articulates clearly, actively listens.ACHIEVES RESULTS THROUGH TEAMWORK:Is open to diverse ideas, works inclusively and collaboratively, holds self and others accountable, involves others to accomplish individual and team goals.LEADS THROUGH POSITIVE INFLUENCE:Demonstrates strong character; builds partnerships; models a conscious balance between work and personal life; takes personal responsibility for owndevelopment; role models leadership qualities such as motivation, inspiration, passion and trust.COACHES AND DEVELOPS OTHERS:Develops and cares about associates, builds effective teams, helps people be their best, values and manages diversity, provides candid and constructivefeedback.LEADS CHANGE AND INNOVATION:Challenges the status quo, embraces technology, puts forward creative ideas, champions and implements process improvements, gathers the ideas of others,demonstrates good judgment about which ideas will work.EXECUTES WITH EXCELLENCE:Is action oriented, drives for results, sets clear expectations and milestones, reviews progress, acts decisively, solves problems, can be counted on to consistentlymeet or exceed goals.PROVIDES CLEAR AND STRATEGIC DIRECTION:Plans and organizes well, sets a clear and simple course of action, stays focused on the most important priorities, has the ability to visualize and plan for thefuture, understands the industry and marketplace.SAFETY AWARENESS:Identifying and correcting conditions that affect employee safety; upholding safety standards.Instead of using the link to apply, you can send your resume and portfolio directly to me, Alex! My contact information is below.Feel to reach out to me via email!Email: Alex.rinner@ascendum.com

title: Senior Brand / Graphic Designer
description: Brandbeet, a leading design agency, is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Graphic Designer to join our remote team. As a Senior Graphic Designer, you will play a pivotal role in creating outstanding design solutions for our clients. We are looking for someone proficient in branding design, graphic design, and social media design. Your expertise in industry-standard tools and techniques will be vital in delivering top-notch design work. This is a fully remote position with asynchronous work, allowing you to work on your own schedule without mandatory meetings.Responsibilities: Develop innovative and captivating design concepts that align with client briefs and brand guidelines. Execute end-to-end design projects, including branding, marketing collateral, digital assets, and social media content. Collaborate with clients and internal teams remotely to understand design requirements, objectives, and target audience. Create visually striking designs that effectively convey the desired message and maintain brand consistency. Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and design best practices. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior designers as needed. Manage multiple projects concurrently, ensuring deadlines are met and maintaining high-quality standards. Requirements: Proven experience as a Senior Graphic Designer or similar role. Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in branding design, graphic design, and social media design. Proficiency in industry-standard design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.). Solid understanding of design principles, color theory, typography, and layout composition. Ability to work independently, collaborating effectively in a remote, asynchronous work environment. Excellent communication skills to articulate design concepts and ideas effectively. Detail-oriented with a keen eye for aesthetics and visual consistency. Adaptable to changing project requirements and priorities. Job Details: Employment Type: Full-time, remote (asynchronous work with no mandatory meetings) If you meet the above requirements and are ready to take on this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume, portfolio, and any relevant supporting documents.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Who We Are & What We DoWe’re working to change the future of online education by building ground-breaking products that empower both students and teachers to triumph in and beyond the classroom setting. Composed of a small, hard-working group of self-starters who are passionate about what we do and constantly seek new ways we can be better, together. We were fully-remote before COVID, and creating a healthy remote culture is a key priority for us.As a member at Teaching.com, you’ll contribute to the development of transformative educational games that are cherished by millions, such as: Typing.com: The leading learn-to-type software in the world, actively used by millions of students every day. Nitro Type and Nitro Math: Ranked as the worlds top educational game, with daily players in the millions. Reading.com: The premier digital platform designed exclusively to teach reading to children aged 4-7. Who You Are & What Youll DoWe are looking for a curious and passionate designer with a drive towards building web software that enables users to handle complex functions in a simple, elegant, and beautiful interface. You’re less concerned with patting yourself on the back for pixel-perfect designs and more concerned with quickly and efficiently delivering value to our users. The ideal candidate has experience leveraging data, user research and intuition to craft designs.Position TypeFull-TimeSkills & Background Exceptional written communication skills 5+ years of designing web applications A strong portfolio of product UI/UX design, demonstrating a range of capabilities from basic CRUD interfaces to colorful, playful interactions Understanding of web development cycles Proficient in modern design tools and ability to leverage prototyping features Solid understanding of user-centered design and UX principles, as well as experience conducting user research, usability testing, and interpreting user data and feedback. Able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced quickly changing environment A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills A positive attitude and entrepreneurial spirit Bonus: Experience and/or passion for designing in the education marketplace Compensation, Benefits & Perks Competitive salary Fully-vested 401k with matching contributions Annual cash profit sharing Medical and dental benefits Flexible office hours Ongoing education assistance Flexible PTO Remote office hardware reimbursement Company-owned laptop Monthly meal adventure Annual company retreat Everyone at Teaching.com is empowered to move quickly, make decisions, and get things done so we can continue to make learning accessible to our growing community of more than 75 million students and teachers internationally.Join the fully-remote team at Teaching.com to create, develop, and deliver fun and engaging games for students and educators!NO RECRUITERSSorry, we will not transfer or sponsor visas. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.We care deeply about the culture at Teaching.com and have put together a manifesto outlining our values, communication, and product management strategies. Prospective employees will learn a great deal about what its like to work here by reviewing it.

title: Deputy CPython Developer in Residence
description: Job Title Deputy CPython Developer in Residence Job Description The Python Software Foundation (PSF) is hiring for a full-time Deputy Developer in Residence, reporting to the CPython Developer in Residence. Role description In support of The PSF’s mission , we are hiring to facilitate a role within the Python community that will focus on assisting CPython maintainers and the Steering Council. Areas of responsibility will include issue triaging, code review, preparing PR backports, improving the automation around the Python language, and communicating with the core team to ensure their work isn’t blocked. As the Deputy Developer in Residence, you will work full-time on CPython, including a variety of projects covering the day-to-day collaborator workflow on GitHub and continuous integration, applying your technical expertise to design, develop, test, and propose changes with a workflow-minded focus. As an externally funded role, the term for this position will initially be one year with the possibility of extension based on available funding or renewals of funding. Responsibilities Keeping the core development workflow operational to ensure core developers and collaborators are not blocked from contribution. Improving tools and workflows, which are part of the core development experience, to enable a smoother contribution process. Code review of a subset of incoming changes to CPython to help collaborators receive timely communications on their changes. Authoring own changes to CPython to help clean the issue and PR backlog. Responding to requests for assistance from core developers in a timely manner. Restrictions No telecommuting Agencies are OK Requirements Minimum Qualifications Experience with software development using the Python programming language. Experience with open source software development and open source tools and best practices, as a contributor and/or as a maintainer. Experience working with a mix of stakeholders, i.e., volunteers, staff, and sponsors. Ability to work independently in a fully remote environment. Excellent written and verbal communication. Preferred Qualifications Experience in building and deploying networked applications. Experience with software development using the C programming language. Experience with CPython internals. Details Applicants from around the world are welcome for this remote position. If the applicant is based outside the USA, the PSF would offer an independent contractor role, structured with autonomy to meet agreed goals of the position in the manner you determine; income may be subject to US income tax. If the applicant is within the USA, the PSF would offer a full-time employee role with compensation including salary, 401K, as well as health (full premium paid by the PSF), dental, and vision insurance and paid time off. Total compensation will range between $100,000-$120,000 USD based on qualifications and experience. This position will report to the CPython Developer in Residence and collaborate with the Steering Council. Some recurring availability within the US Eastern time zone will be necessary for check-ins and reporting. The ability and willingness to travel annually to PyCon US is a plus for this position. About the Company Apply The call for resumes will be open until July 26th 2023. Please use this link to apply with your resume and cover letter. The Python Software Foundation is a US 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation that holds the intellectual property rights behind the Python programming language. We also run the PyCon US conference annually, support other Python conferences/workshops around the world, and fund Python-related development with our grants program. To see more info about the PSF, check out our Annual Impact Report and public records. We believe that the future of open source must include everyone. We welcome all job-seekers regardless of race, color, ethnicity, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, physical appearance, body size, socio-economic, veteran or disability status. Python is a global community and the PSF aims to support a safe environment for all. More information can be found on our Code of Conduct page. Contact Info Contact: Deb Nicholson E-mail contact: donnotemail@python.org Web: https://pythonsoftwarefoundation.applytojob.com/apply/9jXnEu0MuJ/Deputy-CPython-Developer-In-Residence

title: Educational consultant (Advanced Computer Science course & PCAP/PCAD)
description: Job Title Educational consultant (Advanced Computer Science course & PCAP/PCAD) Job Description Job details: Project based / Part time (~40 hours in total / 8 weeks) Responsibilities: Create a course idea and concept & detailed syllabus & python project descriptions for “Computer Science 3 with Python” course Align course syllabus with TEKS CS3 standards and PCAP & PCAD objectives Provide expertise in computer science & programming field and consult course methodologists on course content Propose points of course improvements based on feedback from partners, students, teachers, team Restrictions Telecommuting is OK Agencies are OK Requirements Advanced English Excellent grasp of computer science / software engineering skills Degree and / or professional experience in computer science / software engineering Experience in online courses creation would be an advantage Pedagogical thinking: appropriate learning activities design and creative approach to lesson development Attention to detail, adaptability, and receptiveness to feedback and direction About the Company YaizY is an online education service with a wide range of high-quality courses in areas defining the future, such as entrepreneurship, innovation, computing, design and multimedia arts. On our platform 8-17 year old kids take live online classes in small groups led by our tutors, all rigorously selected and trained in a proprietary training system. We envision YaizY as a place where every child can find a path to a happy life and meaningful work. YaizY will help kids build their personalized diplomas and utilize a system of partnerships, employers and schools to lead them to internships and employment. YaizY was founded in 2019 by a global team of entrepreneurs, industry experts, and professionally trained, award-winning educators with decades of international experience - all on a mission to become the most trusted online learning platform, inspiring students to turn their passions into professions. Contact Info Contact: Evgeniy Pokrovskiy E-mail contact: evgeniy.pokrovskiy@yaizy.io Web: https://www.notion.so/yaizy/YaizY-Computing-Academic-Authority-ab78b5b392ac4bb695d8225cba835e00?pvs=4
